contentrichtext.text: The '''[[Judo]] competition at the [[1972 Summer Olympics]]''' was the return of the sport following its absence at the [[1968 Summer Olympics]] in [[Mexico City]]. Medals were awarded in six weight classes, and competition was restricted to men only. Among the highlights was [[Willem Ruska]] of the [[Netherlands]] winning gold medals in both the heavyweight and open class competition, becoming the first judoka to win two olympic gold medals. <div class="tright">[[Image:Judo pictogram.svg|100px|border|Judo]]</div> ==Medal summary== {| {{MedalistTable|type=Event}} |- | Lightweight<br>63 kg<br>{{DetailsLink|Judo at the 1972 Summer Olympics – Men's 63 kg}} | {{flagIOCmedalist|[[Takao Kawaguchi]]|JPN|1972 Summer}} | ''vacant''<ref>The silver medal was originally awarded to Bakaava Buidaa of [[Mongolia]], but Buidaa was [[List of stripped Olympic medals|stripped of his medal]] after he tested positive for excessive caffeine.</ref> | {{flagIOCmedalist|[[Kim Yong-Ik]]|PRK|1972 Summer}}<hr>{{flagIOCmedalist|[[Jean-Jacques Mounier]]|FRA|1972 Summer}} |- | Half Middleweight<br>70 kg<br>{{DetailsLink|Judo at the 1972 Summer Olympics - Men's 70 kg}} | {{flagIOCmedalist|[[Toyokazu Nomura]]|JPN|1972 Summer}} | {{flagIOCmedalist|[[Anton Zajkowski]]|POL|1972 Summer}} | {{flagIOCmedalist|[[Dietmar Hötger]]|GDR|1972 Summer}}<hr>{{flagIOCmedalist|[[Anatoliy Novikov]]|URS|1972 Summer}} |- |
